detaileddescription.para: < Light and versatile Embedded Graphics Library (LVGL) < General TFT library (TFT_eSPI) < Communication header for the touch controller - between "FT6206" and LVGL Arduino I2C library < LED driver library (PCA9634) Port expander library (MPC23017) < Bluetooth Module library (BM83/BM64) < SoftwareSerial Library for ESP32 < Sound processor library (BD37544FS) Encoder library for ESP32

briefdescription.para: BM83 MFB Pin, required for BM83 power on.

para.emphasis: Flush the display with the given color.

detaileddescription.para: The lv_disp_flush_ready() function is called after the display has been flushed

parameterdescription.para: The display driver to use.
The area of the display to be flushed.
A pointer to a color structure.

inbodydescription.para: < Software serial for BM83/BM64 Uart communication @ 9600 baud
< Sets the MFB pin (GPIO23) as output (BM83)

detaileddescription.para: Reads the music control buttons and sets the corresponding bits in the configuration register to send the according command to the BM83 module

parameterdescription.para: The parameter is a pointer to the task handle.

detaileddescription.para: When the user clicks on the back button, the previous tab is activated

parameterdescription.para: The object that received the event.
The event that triggered the callback.

detaileddescription.para: When the user clicks on a button, the tab view is set to the corresponding tab

parameterdescription.para: The object that received the event.
The event that happened.

listitem.para: * Standby Mode: When the Standby button is pressed, the 7.5V, +-5V, PVCC, and Power Amp shutdown activation pins are set to low, and the Power Amp mute activation pin is set to high

parameterdescription.para: The button object that we want to attach the event to.
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: Power down process:
Set the power down pin to low.
Set the power amp shutdown pin to low.
Set the +-5V pin to high.
Set the PVCC pin to high.
Sets GPIO26 to ~3.1 V
Set the +-5V pin to high.
Set the 7.5V pin to high.
Set the sound processor pins to the default values.
Set the power down pin to low
Set the power amp mute pin to low.

parameterdescription.para: The button object that we created in the previous step.
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: Power down process:
Set the power down pin to high.
Set the power amp mute pin to high.
Set the power amp shutdown pin to high.
Set the +-5V pin to low.
Set the PVCC pin to low.
Set the DAC1 pin to 0.
Set the +-5V pin to low.
Set the 7.5V pin to low.
Set the sound processor pins to the default values.
Set the power down pin to low

parameterdescription.para: The button object that we created in the previous step.
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: Set the sound processor to the default settings

parameterdescription.para: The button object that we created earlier.
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: The function is called when the user clicks on the "Power amp on" button.
The function sets GPIO26 to ~3.1 V, which is the voltage that the power amp needs to turn on.
The function also enables the power amp by setting the PVCC pin to high.
The function also deactivates the power amp shutdown by setting the shutdown pin to low.
The function also deactivates the power amp mute by setting the mute pin to low.
The function also deactivates the sound processor mute by setting the mute pin to low.
The function ends by printing a message to the serial monitor.

parameterdescription.para: The button object that we want to attach the event to.
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: When the BM83 button is pressed, the MFB pin is set to "High" to power on the BM83.
The BM83 is then powered on by sending the "power on" command over UART.
The MFB pin is then set to "Low". Setting the pin "High" is only required everytime the BM83 Module has to be setup again.

parameterdescription.para: The button object that was clicked.
The event that triggered the callback.

detaileddescription.para: When the user clicks on the "Pair" button, the MMI action "Entering Pairing" is sent to the BM83

parameterdescription.para: The button that was clicked.
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: Set the sound setup to the default values

parameterdescription.para: the button that was pressed

detaileddescription.para: When the state of the switch changes, print out the state of the switch and set the state of the according MCP23017 pin

parameterdescription.para: The switch object
The event that triggered the callback.

listitem.para: Rotate the rotary encoder and set the volume accordingly

detaileddescription.para: When the encoder is turned, it will send a signal to the microcontroller. The microcontroller will then read the signal and determine if the encoder has been turned. If it has, it will send a signal to the microcontroller that will be read by the encoder_read function. The encoder_read function will then determine if the encoder has been turned.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to the encoder object.
The data object that is passed to the function.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current encoder count and the difference between the current count and the last count

simplesect.para: The difference between the current encoder count and the previous encoder count.

listitem.para: When the user switches to the music tab, the music control container is moved to the foreground and the menu control container is moved to the background.
When the user switches to the menu tab, the menu control container is moved to the foreground and the music control container is moved to the background

parameterdescription.para: The parameter is a pointer to the task handle.

detaileddescription.para: When the slider is moved, the slider value is read and the slider label is updated. The slider value is then used to set the input gain

parameterdescription.para: the slider object
The event that triggered the callback.

detaileddescription.para: When the slider value changes, update the label text and set the bass value

parameterdescription.para: the slider object
The event that triggered the callback.

detaileddescription.para: When the slider value changes, update the label text and set the middle value

parameterdescription.para: The slider object.
The event that triggered the callback.

detaileddescription.para: When the slider value changes, update the label text and set the treble value

parameterdescription.para: the slider object
The type of event that occurred.
